website_summaries.verdict: An affordable table saw for the DIY woodworker.
pros: Sturdy, neat, and tidy with some useful features
cons: Heavy (65 pounds) with no wheels on the stand

customer_reviews.title: BUY BUY BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The last time I got this excited for this little money I had to wait for the statute of limitations to expire before I could talk about it (Joke). The saw has plenty of power, the expanding table works well, sawdust is as well managed as one can get with a small table saw. I bought this because it would shop to me in Alaska and was inexpensive, but man am I impressed! Over 25 years in construction too, and I'm fickle. Looks exactly like the dewalt, probably made in the same place. First thing I did was effortlessly rip a laminated beam made of 2x4s/ Effortlessly-with the stock blade. Just wow.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska Guy

customer_reviews.title: Where can I get a dependable miter that fits this saw?
customer_reviews.text: Great saw for my purposes, light use DIY and preparing various woods for my wood carving. HOWEVER, I am really disappointed with the miter. It is so sloppy that I can't depend on it at all. Worst part is I can't find a replacement that fits the channel in the table. Any suggestions SKIL??? Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Cape Woody

customer_reviews.title: Great for casual use
customer_reviews.text: I’m a beginner woodworker/DIY home improvement person and this is the perfect balance between quality/price/functionality. Comes ready to go out of the box, didn’t need to adjust mine at all. It’s easy to use, has all the safety features and makes great cuts. Some of the frustrating things are adjusting the fence (takes patience and checking for square) and using the miter gauge (difficult to get at the correct angle and the track has play so you have to compensate). If you’re just getting started like me, or need something reliable to use occasionally, I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MeliCap

customer_reviews.title: Don't know if it's good enough for a professional
customer_reviews.text: Don't know if it's good enough for a professional, but it is ABSOLUTELY good enough for me. Did a couple projects requiring a table saw but couldn't find anyone that had one to borrow. Finally had a big enough job to spend the $205 for this and I'm really glad I did. Solid, well built, and well thought though, table folds up and the saw detaches.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Great starter table saw!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been talking about getting a table saw for a few years now as he has become more and more handy and doing projects around our fixer upper home. I figured this would be a great starter table saw, I certainly cannot complain about the price. The set up was a little challenging and the directions left something to be desired but we figured it out and he has used it a bunch of times already! We love how it is adjustable and has a built in measuring system! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Great little table saw BUT it's miter slots are too small to fit a standard size 3/4"x3/8" miter gauge. The gauge that comes with the saw is very light-weight and flimsy. I bought a new, heavier gauge but it doesn't fit in the slots. Why make the slots narrower than the standard size? What were they thinking? So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: P. B.

customer_reviews.title: Miter slots are a slap in the face
customer_reviews.text: Yes the saw can rip ply wood, but to do any precision cuts using the miter application is terrible. Skil, why produce such a terrible product with regards to the miter cuts? There are better saws out there. I thought i did a decent job of researching table saws but i failed. Wish i could return this product, but its too late now. Dont Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Louis Tapia

customer_reviews.title: I was not able to use it. The blade ...
customer_reviews.text: I was not able to use it. The blade was set in the housing at an unusable angle and I was unable to correct it, so, I boxed the whole thing up and sent it back. I was too frustrated with the whole process to want to reorder another skil saw and requested my money back. I received a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for the DIY or occasional user
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Skil to replace a 25+ year old Delta portable table saw that had croaked. Compared to the Delta, this saw has more, better designed safety features, which means I'm more likely to keep them enabled. The self-aligning rip fence, extendable table, and on-machine storage for tools and accessories are great features. The miter gauge does not have any positive stops, which is a shortcoming. Like other saws at the Skil's price point, the OEM blade is only of adequate quality and was noticeably duller toward the end of my cork flooring project. I will replace it with a Diablo blade. The folding table makes the system easy to store in my crowded garage.
customer_reviews.author: White Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Plastic handles and adjusters subpar.
customer_reviews.text: I disliked the fact that I didn’t get to cut the first piece of wood with this saw. I had finished assembling this saw and was checking the bevel angles per the instructions. When I was tightened the bevel angle lock, the handle broke. So, I had the joy of repackaging this saw to send back. Now, I’ll have to borrow a saw AGAIN to finish my remodeling project! DISAPPOINTING! I guess the old adage”you get what you pay for” would apply here.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value, can rip bigger pieces
customer_reviews.text: For this price it is impossible to find a saw that can extend to cut bigger pieces, i looked at a dozen stores. Its even crazier that it comes with a stand. Very sturdy too. Comes with a push stick. The miter gauge is tiny and crap, as is the track, its the tab style instead of T, lots of wiggle. But for this price gets the job done. The safety stuff is poorly designed, in that the blade has to be raised so high to attach it i never use it. At least the riving knife is there. Still would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Just got saw today, used only to ensure accuracy, Everything ASPER, Sir!
customer_reviews.text: Plastic Shroud, thought the worst, read the stories, I will add to this as job progresses, the One thing would change this into a very loving saw, is an Asynchronous Motor, the present machine strarts with such a violence, and aimed square at the Operator. You can bet I stood to the side when I first powered up the saw!!! Oh, Steam Engineer 22 years, machines don't scare me, Because I look for Safe/danger of a tool, but this bugger is so light, I expect it to dance. BTW, GReat Stand, Latch in use even in Storage. Thatz thinking.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL B.

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw.
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised by this little saw. The only downsides I notice are: the blade height adjustment wheel doesn’t lock so it will lower itself. I just ran a bungee cord around the knob to hold it from turning. The table surface has a coating that looks great but adds friction, so makes pushing small stock kinda difficult. Like everything else about it. Better value, features and easier to use than some of the more expensive brands. I like the outfeed support and the other features.
customer_reviews.author: Smoky

customer_reviews.title: Simple but effective...
customer_reviews.text: If you're a professional wood worker or contractor then obviously, look elsewhere. But if you are a DIYer like myself then this will suffice at a decent price. All in all the saw is extremely light weight, and mostly plastic, but seems to be powerful enough for getting the job done. The accessories that come with it are also pretty nice. My only complaint if I were to call it that is the startup of the saw on this thing is insanely startling and loud. The running noise is also pretty out of control as well. But all in all, for the price I don't complain much about it all.
customer_reviews.author: CJC

customer_reviews.title: Tight blade
customer_reviews.text: The saw is great. The only complaint I have is that when I changed the blade to another blade I had purchased from Amazon the original blade must have been installed by a trained gorilla. I agree with the desire to be safe by installing a blade tightly and would error on the side of safety but the original blade was so tight I never would have been able to remove it with the tools provided. Fortunately, as a retire mechanic I had the tools necessary to remove the blade. Otherwise, the saw meets all my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: pics

customer_reviews.title: High quality and great value saw.
customer_reviews.text: This saw is amazing, much higher quality than I expected. I expect this will hold up for a long time, very sturdy and heavy duty. For general home use I can't imagine wanting anything more. The blade is also great unlike others who said it was not. I did purchase an 80T blade for finer work like molding, (  but the included blade works well on everything I used it for. Excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: RFC

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw for DIYers
customer_reviews.text: Just moved into my "new" home about 10 months ago and needed a fence put up. Didn't have a workshop or garage at my last house, so my tools were very limited. Bought this saw to put the fence up and I plan on using it in the future when I start repairing/replacing the deck and whatever other projects arise. This little saw was easy to assemble, not too heavy, so easy to move around the "jobsite", doesn't take up a lot of space in my small shop area, operating it was straightforward and simple. All in all, well worth the price. If you're a occasional DIYer like me, this table saw should do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: John Burkett

customer_reviews.title: Fine for my shop
customer_reviews.text: Works great for smaller projects. It probably works fine for larger projects too, but without proper support around the table, your product will move too much. It has a small table surface. I use several other benches and horses in the shop to help. You will need to buy a new blade unless you’re only doing rough cuts. I recently built a built in bench and shelves for a mudroom.
customer_reviews.author: Mamma 2 one

customer_reviews.title: Meh?!
customer_reviews.text: Saw works as expected but the saw depth guide does not stay in place when cutting boards. The vibration from the saw makes the blade automatically lower very quickly. After cutting three cuts the blade height could lower 1/8”, not a problem if you’re ripping boards, but if you’re making precision mortise cuts this is not what you want to buy. I rigged up a bungee cord to hold it in place, but not what you want to do with a brand new saw.
customer_reviews.author: larry moser

customer_reviews.title: Not working.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot raise or lower the blade more than 1 inch! It gets jammed in guides that are nor parallel. Going back to Delwalt as I should have in the first place. Yes a kit More money!
customer_reviews.author: edwin r.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly OK..
customer_reviews.text: This saw is built pretty well; actually really well considering the price... The miter gauge is the only subpar/cheap thing about it. I was particularly impressed with the stand. It is very sturdy... much better than I was expecting. You can get better portable table saws, but you have to pay twice as much and you won't be getting something that's twice as good.
customer_reviews.author: Pythagoras

customer_reviews.title: Skil table saw
customer_reviews.text: Saw is light weight and easy to move. It is O.K. for home use and small projects. Too light weight for using everyday. The main down sides are, The sliding mitre gauge is really cheaply made and doesn't slide well. Also the width gauge for the rip fence is made of plastic and doesn't stay set accurately.
customer_reviews.author: starman*1

customer_reviews.title: SPEND MORE, GET MORE.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this table saw because it was affordable and it was near the top of a lot of reviews. I totally regret the purchase and am looking to sell it to someone that wants a first time table saw. THE GOOD: It is portable with a built-in stand that is sturdy. THE BAD: The blade has some play in it that can't be removed. The noise is off the charts. The table sucks having non-standard slots that I couldn't find bars to fit. there is so much play in the blade that my sled's groove has went from 1/8 to almost a 1/4". Avoid this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R Mintzer

customer_reviews.title: Cuts stuff good
customer_reviews.text: We just moved to a new house, and are buying our first power tools! This saw is easy to use, and my fiance was like "no table saw I've ever used had half of these safety features" lol. I will say the instruction manual to set up was kind of terrible- there were multiple references to parts of the saw that did not indicate where those parts were or what they looked like, and we still don't know where to put one of the pieces. But I'm sure we'll eventually figure it out. And we're definitely happy with the tool!
customer_reviews.author: Elle Michele

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money for a home user.
customer_reviews.text: I grew up in construction as a kid and and now do casual wood work as a hobby and home repair and this saw is awsome. So far it has stayed very true to the measurements on cuts fence stays straight nothing has broken yet. I have had it and been using it for almost a year now and it's worked great so far. It has a metal too and metal stand and olast body, fence is made of metal. I don't know how long it would last on construction sites but for the home user it's great and we'll worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Great value but not without sin
customer_reviews.text: I have many many praises for this saw but I'll just skip right to my complaints. The rip fence has a small gap and sometimes the lip of a vinyl plank will slide under. The fence handle is also bothersome. The shape of the handle gets in the way when eyeballing a cut by holding a board up to the blade. The miter gauge is finicky. It doesn't fit very well in the T slot. The slots in the table aren't 3/4". This makes it much harder finding accessories. I bought a hedgehog and it didn't fit and I was out 30 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Dick Sprague

customer_reviews.title: Table top not flat
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult using this table saw for woodworking. Table surfaces on either sides of blade is completely different. Using a level or anything flat across the surface you would be able to notice a huge gap on one side. Too late to return when i realized.
customer_reviews.author: rods

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in almost every way
customer_reviews.text: I love this table saw! I was using a super cheap Ryobi saw before this one and this is WAY better in every way! I love that the table extends out 24 inches. The outfeed support that pulls out the back is also a great feature. You can’t beat this for the price! The only improvements I would like is added security with the on/off switch. The ryobi I had needed a yellow key to be inserted before turning it on, but the Skilsaw doesn’t have anything. Other than that, this saw is about as good as it gets!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and cuts
customer_reviews.text: This table saw and stand was just what I needed to put up shiplap in my house. It helped make the project go smoothly and efficiently. Exact cuts and easy to use. If I can do it and can. I have never used a saw or anything like this before. Definitely have a list of things I want my hubby to help with me now around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Basic saw
customer_reviews.text: I use these little job site saws all the time. This is a daily basic saw with a well built stand. The fence lock is not user friendly, it needs a better lever a guy can actually grab! I noticed as I raise the blade it would wander side to side about 1/8”, not good. I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Builderdude

customer_reviews.title: Great saw.
customer_reviews.text: Arbor fits a dado blade. I would have bought dewalt but like I said, the arbor fits a dado blade. A couple short bungies is all it takes to keep the blade height steady. Otherwise it moves around. Safety components are easily and reliably removed and disposable. I do not recommend this practice. But yeah, fits dado blade, safety doesn't have to be in the way, cuts through a 2/4 (the 3.5" dimension) without complaining. The stand is good enough too. Buy this saw. It's good.
customer_reviews.author: OspreyH

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Pro's.. Price, Con's, .. No slow start. When you hit the switch, it slams on to high speed immediately. The channels for the miter gauge are custom. You can't make your own jig. The blade angle keeps slipping off zero. No vacuum port. If you want a inexpensive saw for a jobsite or small project, this is OK. Other than that, buy a more expensive one.
customer_reviews.author: VinceB

customer_reviews.title: Blade wobbles
customer_reviews.text: The blade wobbles due to the blade height adjustment being bent. I believe the part was bent by the strapping when it was packaged. Either way I now need to replace this peace but can’t find it. I would have returned it, but all the packaging has been thrown away.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin McMorrow

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to build my Long Langstroth honey bee hives. Spend a bit of time checking and setting up and be rewarded with a very functional table saw.
customer_reviews.author: Dulcelife

customer_reviews.title: Works great, although check blade raising & lowering
customer_reviews.text: I bought this table saw a few weeks ago and was very happy with quality for such a good price. It was easy and straightforward putting it together, but when I finished i noticed that when i raised and lowered the blade, the blade would slide side to side as it moved. I returned it for a new one and it works great, the first might have been just a faulty or bent drive screw. Great product, just a reminder to make sure you double check alignment and everything on your new table saw!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan McQuaig

customer_reviews.title: Pass this one!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this saw now almost 5 years, I've tried everything to get this P.O.S. to cut square! Not going to happen. the fence is CRAP, the blade wobbles, etc, etc. I never really needed perfect cuts, so I just delt with it. now I'm retired, and I'm doing a lot of finer work. THIS SAW WILL NOT DO IT! If you want a CHEAP SAW, TO DO CHEAP WORK, GO FOR IT!! just remember, I TOLD YOU SO!
customer_reviews.author: S.N. Indiana

customer_reviews.title: Not for mitre cuts! NOT for corners!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw to frame about 30 paintings. Ooof!! Great saw with the better blade purchase- yeah makes cuts! But I MITRE joint with critical 45°s??? Nope! Today I am having to purchase yet ANOTHER guide to use the 5/8 (the ONLY saw to use 5/8 instead of the most COMMON 3/4 channel!! Duhhhh! ) guide in my home made sled. . Which they suggested against on the customer service line. They would NOT say they could build a frame using g these guides out of the box, gooood luck!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous value for the money and great safety features
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money. I bought this to do some trim work primarily, put a 60 tooth Freud blade on it and it works great. Not to be confused with a $1,600 cabinet saw. The average contractor it'll be a bargain. Ripped what I needed with plenty of oomph. typically cross cut on my miter saw but if I had to cross cut large stock with the proper jig I'm sure it would do fine.
customer_reviews.author: RFM

customer_reviews.title: Very angry.
customer_reviews.text: We loved our saw until we went to change to a 45 angle and the piece you tighten it to just broke off. I need a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Jdcurtin

customer_reviews.title: Extremely easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to set up. One only need one screw driver and one open wrench. Quality seems pretty good. Motor sounds robust. Seems to have all the gadgets one needs to do small and not so small jobs. Sits very sturdy and like that you can remove the table from the base cery easy. A major plus is that its light! Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DVS73

customer_reviews.title: Base level product
customer_reviews.text: Get the replacement insurance bevel adjustment is temperamental and its seeming Achilles heal.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Chase

customer_reviews.title: Growling motor
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a decent saw for the money.But after only 3 cuts in some 3/4" cherry,the motor was growling so bad I was afraid to use it.No an extremely accurate saw either and the blade seemed to wobble when I first turned it on.Maybe I just got a lemon,but I wont be buying anymore Skil tools.I returned the saw and Amazon is refunding my money,so other than some hassle of packing it back up and driving 20 miles to a UPS drop-off location,im not out.My biggest complaint is that I needed this saw to complete a kitchen project,and waiting for the Dewalt I just ordered has set me back 6 days.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this saw.
customer_reviews.text: Great saw for the price. I've had really good luck with it on a variety of projects. I upgraded the blade right out of the box so I cant comment on the one that came with it. I'd imagine you'd want to do the same. Nice sturdy stand. Over all I'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this table saw in March for home use and I used it 3 times in 5 months, last time smoke came out from motor, stopped working and it's useless now. I can pay to ship it back to company for repairs or bay a new one, definitely not the same brand.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Saw!
customer_reviews.text: This little saw is fantastic for the garage woodworker. Lightweight plastic housing is surprisingly sturdy. I checked the squareness of blade to table and it was accurate enough so I didn’t bother squaring it - used it right out of the box. Powerful little motor on it. For a small saw it is great, and price was right. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Baccus

customer_reviews.title: Stop doing business with this company their workmanship is not up to par.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased February 19 and already after using only 6 times for quick cut projects the motor is shot. No reset or troubleshooting to determine why motor just stopped. I now can’t return this piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Keisha B

customer_reviews.title: Waste of cheap  money
customer_reviews.text: After less than a year of using, pieces are breaking, the locks dont stay tight (so the angle keeps slipping on the blade), and the fence doesn't stay square at all. Try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: A great saw for the money. Cuts cleanly and easily. Accuracy is good when you set up. Miter is small and week and the fence is light and cheap.
customer_reviews.author: William Saffeels

customer_reviews.title: Nice Saw.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice table saw. I am using it for dado cuts. The table had a very rough coating on it that made it hard to move your work across it. Now that it is getting broken in it is much better. The miter slide was not real square to the table. Other than that, it is a nice saw.
customer_reviews.author: don

customer_reviews.title: Product delivered damaged.
customer_reviews.text: Product was delivered pretty damaged. The box looks like it fell out of the truck a couple times and rolled down some hills. Could see 2 big dents and scrapes in the measurement guide before I even opened the box because of the big gouges and holes in the box. The measurement viewer glass is also cracked and there is a big scrape on the top platform. Other than that it looks like a solid piece of equipment, but I have not even tried running it yet. I just got the package today. I am very busy and don't feel like dealing with the hassle of returning it, so I hope it'll work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Baughman

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money and for intended use
customer_reviews.text: For the price and portability, it's a good value. Features such as push stick, etc. (with built-in holders) are nice. Not the most accurate, but for general use, rough cuts it works very well. With practice, accuracy can be improved.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent  for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have used the saw some 1 by's for ripping only a few times. No problems. But the fence seems lightweight and had a little movement when ripping an 8ft 1 by. Attaching the hold down was a real pain, but it works. For the price I would recommend the saw for around the house work.
customer_reviews.author: K. Stedman

customer_reviews.title: Sticky and hard to move adjusters and skides
customer_reviews.text: So I’m not a carpenter , but slide to push the wood is not smooth , and the wood does not slide across the table so smoothly, for the money , it does pretty good
customer_reviews.author: Jason Taub

customer_reviews.title: GOOD SAW GOOD PRICE
customer_reviews.text: GREAT LITTLE POR TABLE TABLE SAW EASY TO SET UP COMES W/ CARBIDE BLADE NOT SORRY OLE STEEL ONE. OUT FEED BAR NOT STURDY BUT NOT A BIG DEAL. BETTER THAN MY LAST 2 10'' SAWS I THINK U COULD BUILD A HOUSE W/ THIS SAW. I BUILT A CHICKEN COOP W/ IT. I'D GIVE IT 6 STARS EXCEPT FOR THE OUTFEED BAR. SOMETIMES U JUST GOT TO USE METAL INSTEAD OF PLASTIC. BUT IF U BUY THIS SAW U'LL GET A GOOD WORKING SAW I REALLY LIKE IT !! GBA
customer_reviews.author: dr arnett

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Light weight works great and value priced. As with anything your skill level will determine your results.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Broke on 3rd use.. wobbly blade and dead motor. Stay away spend a little more and get quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a small workshop. Powerful and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: ROGER W MCCASLIN

customer_reviews.title: Arrived October 17, 2017. Have used for minor ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived October 17, 2017. Have used for minor cuts including plywood, small dimensional lumber consisting mostly of 1" material. Small amounts of 2" material have been cut. This saw just blew smoke and bound up during the ripping of a 2x10x8. Not worth the money. Save it and get a Dewalt or Bosch.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice table top saw!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous saw for the money hands down. Easy to set up and use with nice useful features. Only reason I gave it four stars instead of five is because wheels on the frame to help maneuver it around would have been a plus. I would recommend this saw and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Claude A.

customer_reviews.title: Great table saw for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great table saw for beginners. The Riving knife is a little wobbly and the overall space for the fence is only 18 inches. Also when you start the unit up it has a very loud pop and shakes the table for just a second. For people that are new to woodworking, don’t let it scare you. Great table saw for the price. I definitely recommend upgrading the feed area by building extensions for the feed out and fence area to better work on larger projects.
customer_reviews.author: Dat

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Use it almost daily for the past 6 weeks and no sign of the blade getting dull. I’ve used it to cut wood for a wardrobe, shelves, cabinets, etc. with no problem. Fits perfectly in my corner of the garage that I set up as a work space. I’m glad that I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: AlanAndMel

customer_reviews.title: Obsolete Saw
customer_reviews.text: Missing 3 different parts, when I called skill, I was told they quit making saw about 3 years and had very few parts left to support the saw.
customer_reviews.author: connie

customer_reviews.title: Not a Saw Stop but still very good.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 5 stars because of its price to value. I do wish it had a dust port to attach a vac to. But for what it is, it's pretty accurate. Not out of the box though. You do have to make slight adjustments. But that's to be expected. But once you square the fence and blade, it holds true for many cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Tyrone Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: An affordable and very competent table saw.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is a saw complete with the necessary adjustments and an accurate fence. In storage (see picture), with blade fully retracted and safety gear taken off, it doubles as a steady working space.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TABLETOP SAW @ REASONABLE PRICE !!
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift My husband loves it !! Easy to use, much sturdier than most other tabletop models. Comes with a stand that is very stable. BUT is quite heavy !!
customer_reviews.author: TDJones

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This saw fits all of my needs. I have used this model for over four years at work, would borrow it over the weekend. I finally decided that it was time to get my own.
customer_reviews.author: Grizzly Adam

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be fooled
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw after reading glowing reviews on different sites, and thought that it would suit my needs. Upon assembly, the blade adjustment mechanism was faulty and stripped the knob. This saw is cheap plastic. Now I have to go through the trouble of returning it. I’m going to upgrade and spend the extra money like I should have in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: John Vogt

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: It worked pretty well before it stopped working, but it didn't last. Not the most maneuverable in my opinion but got the job done while it lasted. Maybe we got a defective one. I'd still try it out.
customer_reviews.author: Harish

customer_reviews.title: Excellent table saw for the money
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly and the table is excellent quality for the money. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D. Lazar

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the way you can expand the size of the tale and the bar in the back to make it easier to cut larger pieces!!! Had a little trouble understanding how to fit the safety and kick-back claws - - - but once I figure o\it out it made perfect sense.
customer_reviews.author: Garry

customer_reviews.title: Part received damaged.
customer_reviews.text: One of the extension arms came damaged. It had a screw already in it which won’t come out. I probably received a return item! Didn’t have time to return and wait for another one so im stuck with it I guess.
customer_reviews.author: FN

customer_reviews.title: Problem right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Just now unboxed the saw to use. Purchased it in January for an upcoming project that got delayed so I’ve missed my return window. The saw will not go to 0 degrees. Stops at 6 degrees can’t figure out why. I will attempt to call customer service on the instructions. I’ve read others have experienced the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: ELDON WILLIAMSON

customer_reviews.title: Great table saw
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and use, great safety features and very portable at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.author: BG Dziedz

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Value
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this table saw for the last couple of weeks. It is the best money I have ever spent. I use it for most all my woodworking projects. It is compact and it is very powerful. I know I will enjoy using it for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa Magana

customer_reviews.title: Take a closer look.
customer_reviews.text: There are some punch outs on the deck that are a pain to work with. The Miter Gage is rather cheep. It was packaged well and easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Sojourner

customer_reviews.title: Great little table saw
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little table saw and I've used it a lot. The only drawback is the mitre block or gauge. Narrow slot prevent me from using a standard slot for the slide, which I had purchased one from amazon a while back with the 3/4" slide bar. The gauge the comes with the saw is flimsy but accurate enough to cut straight cuts and ok on 45 degree angles. The saw itself is great. Just wish it was 12" instead of 10".
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Good price would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Family handyman works great haven’t lost a finger yet. For what I need it for totally sufficient sturdy good price would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Montanalivin

customer_reviews.title: Table saw
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent saw. You can’t do better for the price. Works great very easy to set up and use. I bought to do some finish carpentry work in my home and it didn’t disappoint. I highly recommend this saw.
customer_reviews.author: wingdad19

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This saw has been awesome. Best value for the money also! Setup was moderately easy. And the utility of it so far had been great. This was the best value I could find when ordering a table saw.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Plastic holder for tilting motor and blade up to 45 degrees busts apart
customer_reviews.text: I liked it when it worked, for about 5 times, then the white little plastic part tat acts as a spacer to move the blade to different angles disintegrated, with no way to replace it. I advice anyone thinking about buying this product to look else where.
customer_reviews.author: I. RoeBuck

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: All in all was as expected a decent saw for most of my needs fairly accurate just need to double check once in awhile have not had to adjust as of yet.safety features are good mostly plastic.have used a fair amount and no real poblems encounterd.not made for major construction site but for home remodeling and building is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Not a good tool, we returned it.
customer_reviews.text: Seems safe and sturdy and portable. However, was not accurate and would not go into full range of expected angles.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: For a need occasionally table saw that is light weight and very portable this saw is great. You won't bog this saw down. Plenty of horsepower.
customer_reviews.author: IdahoTradNut

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a Dewalt that was twice this price. This one cuts just as well, wears just fine, and has a larger table to make ripping easier! Plus it's about the same size so traveling is no problem...
customer_reviews.author: B. McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Is as good as I need it to be.
customer_reviews.text: I recognize that this table saw is not for pros, but for hobbyists like myself, it's more than enough. Cuts very clean, and has all the tools, guides, and accouterments that one might need for making straight, sure cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Install your own floor, forget Luna, YouTube and buy this macgine
customer_reviews.text: Makes my project much easier and best of all, it’s cheap compared to other similar items. Love that I came with the stand. A must have for a handy person to do projects at home.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated, table saw slides down during operation
customer_reviews.text: I expect the saw to stay at the same heigh when operating, but it "vibrates" itself down. I can't make the same cut twice! I have to use duct tape to prevent the height-adjustment-wheel from turning during this operation. Very frustrated. Contacting Skil on Monday...
customer_reviews.author: Meh D

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great saw for the price. Easy to set up and use. Accurate fence settings. Works well with my 8” stacked dado. Only ding is blade height can vibrate change to shallow cut. Would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my boyfriend for Christmas he loves it .i don’t know that much about tools but he said it was great.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Glauner

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Love this I bought if for my husband but I love using it more than him j think. So easy and just perfect for diy projects
customer_reviews.author: 3dm's

customer_reviews.title: Wow...what a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Whoever designed this safety has obviously never used a tool in their lives. It has to be removed in order to use this as a saw. Maybe it's deliberate, making people void the warranty to avoid lawsuits?
customer_reviews.author: Roy Sjolander

customer_reviews.title: Skil makes good tools
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that I'm impressed. The saw was fantastic. I had to rip siding boards down to 5 1/2 inches by 14ft. Long and the saw powered thru with no resistance. And the fence I set at 5.5 inches on the measurement scale and it was right on the money.I really like this saw.I would recommend this saw to anyone who works with wood
customer_reviews.author: Gary c.

customer_reviews.title: Minor damage
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Only problem I had was that it had some minor damage. The base below the cutting surface is made of plastic so be aware. I was able to super glue the damage to prevent future spreading.
customer_reviews.author: AshleyD22

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical when I was thinking of buying this tablesaw. After using it it is quite capable of doing anything a large contractor table saw can do but it’s much more maneuverable.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Zero degree cut not possible
customer_reviews.text: Saw would not go to true zero degrees. Tried multiple adjustments. No online support to help.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeye

customer_reviews.title: A strong saw
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful saw great blade. A great price I look forward. To many great jobs ahead
customer_reviews.author: Sunuia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent saw for the money
customer_reviews.text: Not as substantial a saw as the one I replaced, but it’s lighter and cuts really well
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: great saw, works great, good size, weight, and power for the money!
customer_reviews.author: ggag55

customer_reviews.title: Skil Table Saw
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely LOVES this table saw! He's already built himself a small office area!
customer_reviews.author: Aislinn Firehawk

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great saw for the price. Set up is a little bit more cumbersome than it could be due to the fact that the instructions aren’t the most well written. But still isn’t too difficult to handle.
customer_reviews.author: jpville

product_meta.title: SKIL 3410-02 10-Inch Table Saw with Folding Stand
product_meta.description:
Skil 3410-02 10" Table SawSkil 3410-02 10" Table Saw Features: Table saw Heavy duty folding stand for fast setup and easy transport Cut height capacity cuts through 4 times materials Self aligning rip fence for accurate measurements Miter gauge guides work pieces when making cross cuts EZ view measurement system for accurate settings On tool storage for all accessories and guarding system Die cast aluminum table Includes 3410 table saw.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Skil Benchtop Power Tools are Quality Tools at a Great Price !
feature_bullets: 20-Inch x 26-Inch cast aluminum table extends to 20-Inch x 32-Inch for longer work pieces
3-1/2-Inch cut height capacity for cutting through 4x materials
Heavy-duty steel stand for fast setup and easy transport. Bevel Angle Range:0° to 47°
Self-Aligning Rip Fence for accurate measurements
EZ view measurement system for accurate settings.Cord Length:6 feet

specifications.Warranty Description: 30 Day Money Back Guarantee - 1 year warranty
